item.title: Microfinance mayhem: This MFI ​could have ​‘going concern’ issues | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Microfinance mayhem: This MFI could have ‘going concern’ issues

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Stock Market News

In 2018, Warburg Pincus made a significant investment in the Indian microfinance sector, specifically in Fusion Microfinance Ltd, which went public on November 15, 2022, with shares closing at ₹324. However, by August 2023, the stock had surged to ₹692 per share.

  • Warburg Pincus invested in Fusion Microfinance Ltd in 2018.
  • The company was listed on 15 November 2022, starting at ₹324 per share.
  • The stock peaked at ₹692 in August 2023.
  • Current concerns over Fuson Microfinance’s financial viability have emerged.
“Investors are worried about the potential 'going concern' issues related to microfinance institutions.”

The unfolding situation suggests a deeper scrutiny of microfinance viability, particularly as market conditions fluctuate.

item.title: Earnings growth slowdown appears temporary, says Franklin Templeton's Hari Shyamsunder | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Earnings Growth Slowdown Seen as Temporary by Franklin Templeton's Hari Shyamsunder

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Live Mint

Hari Shyamsunder of Franklin Templeton discusses the implications of recent corporate earnings trends, suggesting that the current slowdown is likely temporary and that a recovery is on the horizon.

  • Government spending is expected to align with nominal GDP growth.
  • Private capital expenditure is predicted to increase in the next 3-5 years due to higher capacity utilization.
  • Emerging sectors like renewables and electric vehicles will see an uptick in investments.
  • A recovery in corporate earnings is anticipated in the second half of FY25.
  • Increased rural demand will benefit related companies.
“The slowdown in corporate earnings in the second quarter ended September was temporary. A recovery is likely in the second half of FY25.”

This perspective highlights optimism for future growth amid current economic challenges.

item.title: How much do dark matter particles weigh? - The Hindu
item.description:
How Much Do Dark Matter Particles Weigh?

Date: December 23, 2024 Source: The Hindu

A significant update has emerged in the understanding of dark matter, suggesting that the minimum mass of dark matter particles is now revised to 2.3 × 10-30 proton masses, impacting current theories in cosmology.

  • Dark matter is an invisible substance that makes up five-sixths of the universe's matter.
  • Previous assumptions estimated the minimum mass of dark matter particles to be about 10-31 times that of a proton.
  • Recent research indicates the need for heavier particles to better explain the observations from the Leo II dwarf galaxy.
  • Understanding dark matter's distribution could allow it to affect structures at different scales.
“It’s not everyday that particle physics gets to redraw a fundamental goal post by an order of magnitude.” - Nirmal Raj

This finding not only reshapes existing theories regarding dark matter but also emphasizes the evolving nature of scientific inquiry, reflecting a critical advancement achieved through computational methods.

item.title: Champions Trophy: India vs Pakistan on February 23 in UAE - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Champions Trophy: India vs Pakistan on February 23 in UAE

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not specified

India will play their Champions Trophy 2025 matches in the UAE with a notable match against Pakistan scheduled for February 23.

  • The PCB has chosen the UAE as a neutral venue for the tournament.
  • India's group includes Pakistan, Bangladesh, and New Zealand.
  • India will face Bangladesh on February 20 and New Zealand on March 2.
  • The tournament starts on February 19, with Pakistan facing New Zealand in Karachi.
  • Knockout matches including semi-finals and finals may shift venues based on India's progression.
  • This arrangement is part of a hybrid model agreement between India and Pakistan for future ICC events.
“The PCB has picked the UAE as a neutral venue for the Champions Trophy,” said PCB spokesperson Amir Mir.

In conclusion, the Champions Trophy will showcase India and Pakistan in a significant match amidst a hybrid model designed to accommodate both nations in upcoming ICC events.

item.title: Epigamia co-founder Rohan Mirchandani dies at 42 - The Times of India
item.description:
Epigamia co-founder Rohan Mirchandani dies at 42

Date: [Publication_date_here] Source: [Source_name_here]

Rohan Mirchandani, the co-founder of popular yogurt brand Epigamia, has passed away at the age of 42, leaving behind a legacy of innovation in the food industry.

  • Mirchandani played a pivotal role in launching Epigamia, which became one of India’s leading yogurt brands.
  • He was known for his vision and dedication to promoting health-conscious food options.
  • The loss is felt deeply within the community, and tributes have poured in for his contributions to the industry.
“He was a true innovator and guided Epigamia to great heights,” said a close colleague.

The tragic passing of Rohan Mirchandani highlights the impact of his work and the void left in the food and entrepreneurial community.

item.title: Farmers push for SC’s help after parliamentary standing committee backs MSP law - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Farmers Urge Supreme Court to Implement MSP Law After Committee's Support

Date: Dec 23, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Farmers, led by Jagjit Singh Dallewal, are calling on the Supreme Court to enforce the parliamentary committee's recommendation for a legally guaranteed minimum support price (MSP) for farm produce.

  • Dallewal is on a fast-unto-death to push for the implementation of the MSP law.
  • The parliamentary standing committee has emphasized the need for legally guaranteed MSPs for farmers.
  • The report suggests the agriculture ministry should create a roadmap for implementing MSP.
  • MSPs are intended to provide a minimum price to prevent distress sales among farmers.
  • The committee's report discusses the advantages of implementing MSP as a legal guarantee to enhance rural economic growth.
  • If not implemented, the government must provide a formal explanation to the committee.
“Implementing a legally binding MSP in India is essential not only for safeguarding farmers’ livelihoods but also for promoting rural economic growth.”

In conclusion, the farmers' plea, supported by the parliamentary committee, highlights the critical need for legal guarantees to ensure fair compensation for farmers’ produce, which could lead to sustainable farming practices.

item.title: Champions Trophy 2025: India vs Pakistan game to be played on February 23 in UAE - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Champions Trophy: India vs Pakistan on February 23 in UAE

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

India will play their Champions Trophy 2025 matches in the UAE, a decision finalized after discussions with PCB and UAE officials.

  • The India vs Pakistan match is scheduled for February 23.
  • India's group also includes Bangladesh and New Zealand.
  • Pakistan's opening match will be against New Zealand on February 19.
  • All matches are likely to be held in Dubai.
  • The final is set for March 9 in Lahore, with a reserve day.
“The PCB has picked the UAE as a neutral venue for the Champions Trophy,” - Amir Mir, PCB spokesperson.

This decision is part of a hybrid model agreement that ensures neutral venues for certain matches, especially for significant tournaments leading up to 2028.

item.title: Low Bounce, Nothing For Pacers On Practice Pitches: India Train On ‘Flat Tracks’ For Boxing Day Test | Repo - News18
item.description:
India Faces Challenges on Flat Practice Pitches Ahead of Boxing Day Test

Date: December 22, 2024 21:57 IST Source: Times of India

The Indian cricket team is encountering difficulties with the practice pitches at the MCG, leading into the Boxing Day Test. Unlike the conditions expected, the pitches are reported to have lower bounce, which hampers the effectiveness of fast bowlers.

  • Practice pitches at the MCG described as having 'lower bounce' and 'absolutely nothing' for the pace attack.
  • India's quick bowlers struggled to find assistance during the practice session.
  • Australian team has not yet begun their training and may use different pitch conditions.
  • Captain Rohit Sharma faced an injury scare during practice, but it is believed to be minor.
“The Indian captain removed his gear, settled into a chair, and the physio got the ice pack out,” Times of India reported.

The upcoming Boxing Day Test will be crucial for India as they navigate the challenges posed by the pitch conditions and player health.

item.description:
Google TV Sneaks in Dozens of New Free Channels for You to Skip Over

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: 9to5Google

Google TV now offers over 170 free channels, giving US viewers even more content to explore. This update is available for anyone with the latest Google TV software.

  • Google TV Freeplay app features expanded content options.
  • New channels include various holiday-themed names that may be temporary.
  • Viewers can easily navigate the channels through the 'Live' tab.
“Accessing these channels is super easy. Just head to the 'Live' tab, scroll through your recommendations, or use the Google TV channel player to jump right in.”

This expansion comes after a recent increase from 150 to 171 channels, amidst a constant shuffle of adding and dropping content expected to continue through 2025.

item.description:
Bigg Boss 18: Edin Rose and Yamini Malhotra get eliminated; Kashish Kapoor break down into tears saying 'Everybody is a snake here'

Publication Date: N/A | Source: N/A

An emotional episode of Bigg Boss 18 saw the elimination of Edin Rose and Yamini Malhotra, leading to a dramatic reaction from Kashish Kapoor.

  • Edin Rose and Yamini Malhotra were eliminated from Bigg Boss 18.

Kashish Kapoor: 'Everybody is a snake here'

item.title: ‘Risk of cardiac arrest, condition critical’: Doctors on farmer leader Dallewal as fast-unto-death enters Day 27 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Doctors Warn of Cardiac Arrest Risk as Farmer Leader Dallewal Enters Day 27 of Hunger Strike

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, currently on a hunger strike for 27 days, is in critical condition at the Khanauri border protest site.

  • Dallewal is 70 years old and is demanding a legal guarantee for Minimum Support Price (MSP) on crops.
  • Doctors have stated he is at risk of cardiac arrest and multi-organ failure due to his prolonged fasting.
  • His condition shows signs of severe weakness, with symptoms affecting his nervous system and vital organs.
  • On December 26, symbolic hunger strikes will be organized at various levels to support his cause.
  • The farmers continue to protest at border points following failed attempts to march to Delhi.
“He is hemodynamically unstable... He is at risk of cardiac arrest and his condition is critical,” the doctor said.

This situation raises concerns for the safety and wellbeing of Dallewal and highlights ongoing issues related to farmer rights and agricultural policies.

item.title: After Refusing To Travel To Pakistan, India Will Play Champions Trophy Matches At This Venue - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India and Pakistan's Champions Trophy Matches to be Held in UAE

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

Pakistan Cricket Board has confirmed that the UAE will serve as the neutral venue for the 2025 Champions Trophy, amidst ongoing political tensions between India and Pakistan.

  • The PCB announced that matches will be played in the UAE, with confirmation sent to the ICC.
  • This decision affects several ICC events through 2027, including the Champions Trophy 2025 and other upcoming World Cups.
  • Political relations between India and Pakistan limit direct competitions, with the last bilateral series occurring in 2012-13.
  • The Champions Trophy is set for February and March 2025, with scheduling details to be announced soon.
  • Pakistan last played India in a T20 World Cup match earlier this year, which India won.
“Due to strained political relations, India and Pakistan only compete in international events like the World Cup and Asia Cup.”

This arrangement underscores the ongoing complexities in cricketing relations between the two countries, now playing out at neutral venues.

item.title: Walking your way to better health: Faster pace linked to lower risk of metabolic diseases - The Week
item.description:
Walking Your Way to Better Health: Faster Pace Linked to Lower Risk of Metabolic Diseases

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Scientific Reports

A recent study finds that individuals who walk at a faster pace may be at a lower risk of developing metabolic conditions, including diabetes and cardiovascular diseases.

  • The study analyzed data from nearly 25,000 participants with obesity or high waist circumference.
  • Participants who identified as 'faster walkers' had a 30% lower risk of diabetes.
  • Notable reductions in risks of hypertension and dyslipidemia were also observed.
  • Faster walkers typically exhibit better cardiorespiratory fitness, linked to lower inflammation and oxidative stress.
  • The findings suggest promoting a faster walking pace could help prevent metabolic diseases, particularly among those with obesity.
  • Measuring subjective walking speed could provide critical insights in health settings.
“Measuring subjective walking speed could help identify individuals at high risk of metabolic disorders.” - Kojiro Ishii

The study underscores the importance of walking pace as a potential preventive measure for metabolic diseases, emphasizing its simplicity and accessibility for public health applications.

item.title: Small plane crashes into shops in Brazil tourist town, all 10 passengers killed - The Indian Express
item.description:
Small plane crashes into shops in Brazil tourist town, all 10 passengers killed

Date: December 2024 Source: Indian Express

In a tragic incident in southern Brazil, a small plane crashed into shops in the center of the tourist city of Gramado, resulting in the loss of all ten passengers on board.

  • Initial reports confirm no survivors from the crash.
  • At least 15 people were hospitalized due to smoke inhalation from the resulting fire.
  • The plane struck a chimney before hitting a house and finally crashing into a furniture store.
  • The incident occurred just days before Christmas, impacting a busy tourist season.
  • Earlier this year, Gramado faced severe floods that affected the local economy.
“Unfortunately, initial reports indicate that the aircraft’s occupants did not survive,” Governor Eduardo Leite stated on social media.

This tragic event has shocked the popular tourist destination, raising concerns about safety and emergency response in the region.

item.title: Pushpa 2 box office collection day 18: Allu Arjun house vandalised over stampede case even as film makes ₹1063 crore - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Pushpa 2 box office collection day 18: Protesters vandalised Allu Arjun's Hyderabad house

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses the impressive box office performance of Pushpa 2 while highlighting the vandalism of Allu Arjun's house due to ongoing issues related to a stampede incident.

  • Pushpa 2 has grossed approximately ₹1063.64 crore net in India by the 18th day of its release.
  • The film collected ₹33.99 crore on its third Saturday, showing strong performance.
  • Allu Arjun's house was vandalized by protesters related to the stampede case that occurred during the film's premiere.
  • The actor has expressed his condolences and pledged financial assistance to the victim's family.
“Everyone has seen what happened at our house today. But it is time for us to act accordingly.” - Allu Arjuna's father

The incident raises concerns over fan conduct at film events and the implications on public safety.

item.title: 9 reasons to have soybean for dinner - The Times of India
item.description:
9 Reasons to Include Soybeans in Your Dinner

Publication Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Times of India

Soybeans are highly nutritious and can significantly enhance your dinner experience. They offer various health benefits and are versatile in various recipes.

  • High in plant-based protein (about 36 grams per 100 grams).
  • Good source of vitamins and minerals (iron, magnesium, potassium, folate).
  • Supports heart health by lowering bad cholesterol levels.
  • Promotes bone strength with high calcium content.
  • Improves digestion due to high dietary fiber content (9.3 grams per 100 grams).
  • Helps balance hormones with isoflavones.
  • Aids muscle recovery post-exercise.
  • Versatile and can be used in multiple dishes (tofu, soy milk, etc.).
  • Helps with weight control by keeping you fuller longer.
"Soy isoflavones mimic estrogen, thus aiding in hormonal balance and offering huge benefits for menopausal women."

In conclusion, incorporating soybeans into your diet not only adds variety to your meals but also contributes to your overall health.

item.title: 'Why so much hatred?': Kejriwal attacks Centre after Delhi tableau misses cut for R-Day parade; BJP hits - The Times of India
item.description:
'Why so much hatred?': Kejriwal attacks Centre after Delhi tableau misses cut for R-Day parade; BJP hits back

Publication Date: [Not Available] Source: [Not Available]

The article discusses Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's criticisms of the central government after the Delhi tableau was not selected for the Republic Day parade. The BJP responded to these comments, highlighting the political tensions between the two parties.

  • Kejriwal expressed frustration over the exclusion of the Delhi tableau.
  • The criticism targets the central government, claiming it reflects hostility towards Delhi.
  • BJP officials countered Kejriwal's statements, defending the selection process.
“Why so much hatred?” - Arvind Kejriwal

This incident has sparked significant political dialogue regarding the treatment of Delhi by the central government and the implications for future representations at national events.

item.title: Proxy advisors call for Rashmi Saluja's ouster from Religare; co backs her | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Proxy Advisors Urge Shareholders to Oust Rashmi Saluja from Religare's Board

Publication Date: N/ASource: Company Business News

Two leading proxy advisory firms have recommended Religare Enterprises investors Ltd (REL) to vote against giving a fresh five-year term on the company's board to chairperson Rashmi Saluja, amidst her ongoing conflict with the company's largest shareholders, the Burman family.

  • Proxy advisory firms are pushing investors to reject Saluja's re-appointment.
  • Her leadership is challenged due to a feud with the Burman family, the largest shareholders.
  • The decision comes as her re-appointment was already uncertain.
“Proxy advisors play a crucial role in shaping corporate governance outcomes,” said an industry expert.

This situation highlights the influence of proxy advisors in corporate governance and raises questions about Saluja's future at Religare.

item.title: What Happened Between Blake Lively And Justin Baldoni? A Full Breakdown Of The 'It Ends With Us' Feud - News18
item.description:
What Happened Between Blake Lively And Justin Baldoni? A Full Breakdown Of The 'It Ends With Us' Feud

Date: December 22, 2024

Source: News18

The lawsuit filed by Blake Lively against Justin Baldoni has sent shockwaves through Hollywood, revealing significant tensions and a toxic work environment during the production of their film, 'It Ends With Us'.

  • Blake Lively alleges sexual harassment by Justin Baldoni during the filming.
  • The film, released amidst rumors and on-set tensions, grossed $350 million worldwide.
  • Reports surfaced alleging difficulties in production, including creative conflicts and behavioral misconduct.
  • Colleen Hoover, author of the novel, expressed support for Lively amidst the allegations.
  • After the lawsuit, Baldoni's talent agency dropped him as a client.
“I hope that my legal action helps pull back the curtain on these sinister retaliatory tactics… and helps protect others who may be targeted.” - Blake Lively

This ongoing situation highlights the need for safer working environments in the film industry and has sparked significant public discussion.

item.title: What's Getting Cheaper And Costlier After GST Council Meeting? Check Full List - News18
item.description:
What's Getting Cheaper And Costlier After GST Council Meeting? Check Full List

Date: December 22, 2024 Source: News18

The GST Council's 55th meeting led by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman reviewed and made significant changes to GST rates, impacting various goods and services.

  • Reduction in GST on Fortified Rice Kernel (FRK) to 5% to enhance affordability.
  • Full GST exemption on gene therapy to improve accessibility.
  • Exemption for contributions to the Motor Vehicle Accident Fund from GST.
  • No GST on transactions involving vouchers.
  • No GST on penal charges levied by banks and NBFCs for non-compliance.
  • Reduction in pre-deposit for appeals regarding penalty amounts.
“The GST Council aims to provide relief to individuals and streamline compliance,” remarked Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

This meeting signifies an effort to enhance the economic landscape by adjusting tax rates strategically to support various sectors.

item.title: Allu Arjun's father talks about their Hyderabad home being vandalised over Pushpa 2 stampede case - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Vandalism at Allu Arjun's Home After Pushpa 2 Incident

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Allu Arjun's father, Allu Aravind, addressed the press after protesters vandalized their Hyderabad home, demanding money for a victim of a recent stampede at a film event. The police have arrested the offenders and are prepared for further actions.

  • The incident occurred due to demands related to a stampede at a film event promoting Pushpa 2.
  • Protesters vandalized the property, breaking flower pots and pelting tomatoes.
  • Allu Arjun stated he was unaware of the woman’s death until the next day after the event.
“Everyone has seen what happened at our house today. But it is time for us to act accordingly. Now is not the right time for us to react to anything.” - Allu Aravind

In conclusion, the incident underscores the intense pressure facing celebrities following tragic events and the public's expectation for accountability.
